result.execSummary:
The defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Brenda Bartholomew and Dawn Muldonado sworn in as Spanish interpreters.
cab
Case was calendared for a final pretrial today.
.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....
As to counts 2 and 4:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to counts 1 and 3:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing,
Parties wish to proceed to sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
As to count 2:
 Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. Credit given for *days time served if revoked.
.
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 years with the following conditions:

- Court IMPOSES and STAYS 120  Days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.  
- Follow all rules of probation.
-Batterers Intervention Treatment.
- Obtain and Maintain employment.
- AODA and Mental Health assessment and any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons
Defendant's voting rights have been lost.
- Defendant to have no contact with the victim unless approved by the court.  
-Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by end of probation, including DV assessment and supervision charges.
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample.  Defendant to pay DNA surcharge if not already paid.
The court found that the defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program but NOT the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court ordered case calendared for a probation review hearing in branch 36.
 
As to count 4:
The court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with 77 days credit.  
Time served disposition.

 Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties no longer wish to argue bail.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Guzman. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Melissa G; Placito L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 3 and Count 4.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  
Defendant Magdaleno Carrera Cervantes in custody.  
Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
